title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 484.8 - Extension of time for filing returns and payment of tax
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 484.8 - Extension of time for filing returns and payment of tax

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 505, 506
(a) The State Tax Commission may grant a
reasonable extension of time for filing a return whenever good cause exists. An
application for an extension of time should be made prior to the due date of
the return and should be mailed or delivered to the Miscellaneous Tax Bureau. (See section
470.1
[a]
of this Title.)
(b) On application
of any taxpayer before the due date of a return, the Tax Commission may grant a
reasonable extension of time for the payment of any tax, on such conditions as
it deems just and proper. Notes
